name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Site cleared and graded as per design; kerb line marked, and utilities identified to avoid conflicts.
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD - Confrim site setup and markings before formwork installation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Formwork set to specified alignment and profile, with correct height and level, secure and free of movement
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD - Inspect formwork for stability and alignment before reinforcement.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Reinforcement placed as per design, with correct cover, spacing, and securely fixed in position.
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD - Verify reinforcement placement before concrete pour.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Concrete mix complies with design specifications (e.g., strength, slump, and mix ratio); verify batching records.
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD - Check concrete mix quality upon delivery.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Concrete poured continuously  and compacted to avoid air pockets; proper finish achieved on kerb face.
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD - Inspect pour for consistent compaction and surface finish.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Kerb surface finished to specified texture and profile; edges clean and sharp as per design.
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD - Verify surface finish before initial curing.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Apply curing compound or cover with moist material; ensure curing process follows project specifications.
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD - Inspect curing method and ensure it is maintained for the specified period.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Expansion and control joints installed at specified intervals and filled as per design.
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD - Check joint placement and filling before final inspection.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Verify kerb alignment, elevation, and surface finish against design tolerances; no visible cracks or defects.
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD - Final inspection before project sign off.
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
